Journal.Title: Journal of the Pediatric Infectious Diseases Society

Article.ArticleTitle: Genotypic Diversity of Childhood Rhinovirus Infections.

Abstract.AbstractText: Our objective was to describe the distribution of rhinovirus (RV) by species and type in both symptomatic and asymptomatic children in a prospective study over multiple years. A large and diverse distribution of RV types was seen among children with and without symptoms. RV-A and RV-C were predominant at all visits.
